chapter.title: The OPAC module
chapter.para: OPAC stands for Online Public Access Catalogue. The OPAC module allows readers to carry out a search in the library catalogue.
The PMB OPAC module is in fact a WebPAC : an OPAC accessible via the Web.
How to configure the OPAC is described in the PMB Administrator's Guide.
The OPAC can be separate from the PMB management interface, it can be placed on a separate server. For more information about installing the OPAC consult the PMB Installation Guide.
Note this chapter is not the OPAC help, but only a quick aide-memoire. A Guide to the PMB OPAC is currently in preparation.

sect1.title: Accessing the OPAC
sect1.para: The OPAC catalogue of the PMB-managed library will be accessible by default at the following internet address :
However, for the other workstations on a local network, you need to replace localhost by the network name of the PMB server.
To obtain this name under Windows, right-click on My Computer then select Network ID. You will then be shown the name of the machine on the local network.

The online catalogue produced by PMB is dynamic: It is automatically updated at each reload of the page. Therefore an update made in the management interface (see following sections) is reflected immediately. A newly catalogued item is also accessible immediately in the OPAC.

sect1.title: The OPAC Interface
sect1.para: The PMB OPAC displays 3 main areas of information on the screen

listitem.para: A "search" dialogue area is found at the top of the page.
New : Starting with version 1.3, the OPAC offers an advanced search feature.

Subject headings are presented in the bottom right area. Other blocks can also be displayed. The OPAC is highly customizable. For more information, consult the Administrator's Guide , Tools chapter, Parameters section.

The left column (which can be disabled from Administration > Tools > Parameters) offers the reader the possibility to identify himself by entering his barcode on his reader's card and displays the address of the library. The library's address can be configured in Administration > Tools > Parameters (For more information consult the PMB Administrator's Guide, Tools chapter).

sect1.title: Quick search
sect1.para: If you enter a term in the "Search" textbox, the OPAC will display the results of your search. You can further refine your search by checking or unchecking the boxes which correspond to the elements to query : title, author, series...
The PMB OPAC stores all your search history throughout the duration of your session (as from connection, that is, the first OPAC window opened by you).

sect1.title: Browsing the subject index
sect1.para: Designed to facilitate the exploration of resources, the subject index corresponds to a hierarchically organized thesaurus that need to be loaded with subject terms to be usable in PMB.

sect1.title: Accessing readers' accounts from the OPAC
sect1.para: Readers registered in the management interface can access their account from the OPAC. For that, they need their reader's barcode (or identifier) to be found on their library card, and their password as well.
Note : by default this password is identical to the reader's barcode. It can be changed in the management interface, or at any time by the reader himself by accessing his account in the OPAC.
